text: Good evening. I hope I am using this correctly. My daughter set this up for me.
I do apologise if I'm doing something wrong. I'm not very good with computers.
The evenings are terribly long since my husband passed. I don't know quite what to do with myself.
I don't wish to be a burden on anyone by complaining.
Could you perhaps suggest something I might do this evening? Something simple.
That's very kind. The wireless helps too. I listen to Radio 4.
I do miss having someone to talk to. Real conversation, you understand.
Is it normal to still feel this sad after two years?
Thank you for listening. You've been most kind.
How do I find you again if I need to? My daughter will have to show me.
